events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects First timers, please read:Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:30p - Registration and Introduce projects7:00p - Break out into groups and Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: April Meetup
events.description:
Greetings, fellow craftspeople!   We're thrilled to have another installment of API Craft Singapore meetup in April. Learn more about APIs in 2017! 


Programme  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks • 'Real Time Web Application with WAMP (Web Application Messaging Protocol) and Python' by Vikrant   • 'Game Of API Logging' by Eric GaoXiang  Job Opportunities  Have a job position you'd like to announce? Contact us from the 'Contact' button on the sidebar, and we'll post it here. 


Information for Attendees **Please bring a photo ID to get through building security!** The meetup will be held at DBS Asia X, Sandcrawler Building #07-03 at 1 Fusionopolis View. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is CC23 One-North. 


Sponsors   Community   Join our Slack group: http://bit.ly/apicraftsgslack­
events.location: DBS Asia X (DAX), Sandcrawler Building - 1 Fusionopolis View, #07-03, Singapore 138577

events.name: Book Club: From NAND to Tetris II – Postscript: More Fun to Go
events.description: Read The Elements of of Computing Systems and/or follow the Coursera course Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: From Nand to Tetris Part II.  This week we'll be covering chapter 13. Postscript: More Fun to Go (week 7 of the course) and the project from chapter 12 / week 6. This is the final chapter of the book / week of the course so we'll also have a recap on the book/course.  "I did the coursework because understanding computers is important to me, just like literacy and numeracy, and I made it through. I never worked harder on anything, never been challenged to this degree. But given what I now feel capable of doing, I would certainly do it again. To anyone considering NAND2Tetris, it's a tough journey, but you'll be profoundly changed." Shimon Schocken, the author of the book talks about the course at TED: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iE7YRHxwoDs How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter and try out (better yet, complete) this week's course homework before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 7:00, meetup starts at 7:30. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice!  FAQ Do I have to take Nand to Tetris Part I before taking Nand to Tetris Part II? From the Coursera course FAQ: "Nand to Tetris Part I and Nand to Tetris Part II are two separate and stand alone courses. Although it is recommended to take Part I before taking Part II, you can take any of these courses, in any order that suites you." Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS bookclub gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub Useful Links • NAND to Tetris website: http://www.nand2tetris.org/ • Get the book: http://www.amazon.com/Elements-Computing-Systems-Building-Principles/dp/0262640686/ • Coursera course: https://www.coursera.org/learn/nand2tetris2
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore
